statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Richmond 78, St. Joseph's 68
article.story: RICHMOND, Va. (AP) -- Oumar Sylla scored all 15 of his points in the second half and Richmond held off a late rally to beat Saint Joseph's 78-68 on Saturday night. David Gonzalvez scored 21 points for Richmond (7-20, 3-11 Atlantic 10), which shot 61.7 percent from the field. Dan Geriot added 18. Pat Calathes scored 20 points and Jawan Carter 13 for Saint Joseph's (17-11, 9-5). Ahmad Nivins finished with 27 points and nine rebounds. The Spiders took the lead for good at 13-10 on Peter Thomas' 3-pointer with 15:17 remaining in the first half. Richmond led by as many as 10 in the first, before the Hawks rallied to cut the lead to 35-30 at the half. Bob Ferguson hit a layup on the Hawks' first possession of the second half to cut the deficit to three. The Spiders then went on a 13-4 run and took a 48-36 lead with 15:33 remaining. Richmond led by as many as 21 before a late rally by the Hawks cut the deficit to 75-68 with 16 seconds remaining. Nivins led the Hawks' comeback by scoring 15 points.
